issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

fields.summary: Guard against MAPREDUCE-5918 by ensuring RecordReader is only closed once in *HadoopRDD

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description: LineRecordReader can return the same decompressor to CodecPool multiple times if method close() called multiple times. In this case CodecPool doesn't guarantee that it always return different decompressors. This issue can cause some difficult reproducible and difficult diagnosable bugs in Hadoop based programs.
fields.summary: LineRecordReader can return the same decompressor to CodecPool multiple times

This message is automatically generated.

Actually this bug was found during upgrade CDH 4.2.1 to 4.6.0 version. After this update I found that some tests failed with EOFException. During investigation I found that single instance of LineRecordReader closed by Cascading and by MapReduce engine. If it's required I can provide test which can show that this issue crashes Cascading.
Can anyone of committers review this bug fix?

Hi Sergey! Thanks for your contribution! :-) This is a good find. Sorry for taking so long to come around to it.

# Should we do this for the mapreduce api as well (org.apache.hadoop.mapreduce.lib.input) ?
# To me it seems the problem really is that CodecPool is not checking if the instance of Codec being "returned" is not already in the pool. Would you agree? I agree that we should also set decompressor to null after we have returned it.

Hi Ravi,
Thanks for attention, I've added changes to org.apache.hadoop.mapreduce.lib.input.LineRecordReader and updated patch.
1) Yes, we need to update org.apache.hadoop.mapreduce.lib.input.LineRecordReader, I've attached changes.
2) Yes, I agree, CodecPool is not checking if the instance of Codec being "returned".

Hi Ravi,
I've added changes to CodecPool [^MAPREDUCE-5918.3.patch]. Please take a look on it.

Thanks Sergey!
A small nit is please explicitly specify your imports. Otherwise the patch looks good to me. Could you please also merge in the changes to LineRecordReader that you had posted in the previous patch. A single patch with both of these changes would be great and I'll be happy to commit it.
